Articles.Content:
Whenever I make a lander out of a Hitchhiker can and I want monoprop on it, I have to add 120 units - that's two roundified tanks for symmetry.

Can someone make a tiny tank that holds like 5 units of monoprop?

Yeah, I could use tweakables to reduce the amount of monoprop in each tank, but I still have those large, unsightly tanks. Sometimes I do not want to tuck them away in the reaction wheel or stack decoupler - even I sometimes need to refuel monoprop on those multi-mission landers.

Thanks,

TML
You could make them smaller with TweakScale, make a small inline tank with Procedural Parts or take the small radial tanks from Tantares (and delete everything you don't need).
Thanks. I'll give those a look.

[RLA Stockalike](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/90218) have some tiny probe parts, including a small monoprop tank.

It's not updated for 1.0.2 yet (hojiwana is working on it) but there's a [MM patch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php?p=1941070#post1941070) to make it work
